page.title: 16 Roadside Restaurants
page.content: The building of the Boughton by-pass provided new business and employment at the Gate Services,east of Boughton. The former Gate Inn was converted into offices for the new business. The Gate Restaurant,opened in January 1984,employs 8-10 staff, opening every day except Christmas.On a busy weekend 4-500 car travellers use this restaurant,many of them foreign tourists on their way to and from the Channel Ports.The Gate Cafeteria next door,open 24 hours a day,caters for the long-distance lorry driver.The prices are cheaper and a good old fashioned English breakfast of fried bread,egg,bacon and sausage is popular.Behind the nearby petrol filling station is a lorry park.A lorry driver returning north from the continent said he stopped here on the way home each time.
